page.title: 05BROADBAY SOUTH - AERODROME
page.content: Two main airlines serve the Western Isles, British{Airways}and Loganair. There are two British Airways routes which go from{Stornoway to Inverness } (flight time 35 mins) {and Stornoway {to Glasgow }(flight time 60 mins) {The Logan Air routes}are to Barra and Benbecula. Loganair olso operate the Air Ambulance service. In July 1985, 5964 passengers used the airport, a 14% increase on July 1984. Aircraft movements in July were down by 11.2% compared with July 1984 and totalled 1689. There were 12 Air Ambulance flights. The Aerodrome is owned by the Ministry of Defence and leased to the Civil Aviation Authority. There is a small permanent R.A.F. presence, R.A.F. Stornoway.
